trustfund:
TF096822-W2-Overcoming governance and
            fiduciary constraints to service delivery
theme: Administrative and civil service reform,Other public sector governance,Public expenditure, financial management and procurement

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second State
            Modernization Project for Argentina were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was moderate, Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: engaging in
            reforms at the center of government entails acknowledging
            shifts in political priorities and reform space that will
            constrain implementation. Horizontal cross-agency reforms
            should be limited to only a few areas in environments of
            fluctuating political commitment. The efforts entailed in
            coordination should not be underestimated in advancing
            horizontal reforms, particularly when not tied to incentive
            structures, such as financing). To accompany such reforms,
            significant agility in the project’s reform trajectory and
            implementation are needed to remain relevant to shifting
            priorities over time. The use of information and
            communication technology (ICT) in advancing reform progress
            is highly constrained by leadership and organizational
            factors. Despite notable advances in the modernization of
            specific functions assigned to the Chief of Cabinet Office,
            particularly in relation to monitoring public sector
            performance and advancing the e-government agenda, there
            remains space to further build the technical capabilities to
            execute the broad range of functions assigned to the Cabinet Office.
